intro: Ellisia fremontii, commonly known as the Fremont's bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Ellisia fremontii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
